channel.title: BBC News - Business

item.title: NHS blood tube shortage: Supplier ramps up imports
item.description: Becton Dickinson has announced it will deliver 9 million blood test tubes to the NHS this week.

item.title: Ryanair predicts rapid rebound in airline travel
item.description: The budget carrier will launch 14 new routes from London airports this winter, creating 500 new jobs.

item.title: Mission: Impossible Covid shutdowns prompt lawsuit
item.description: Film maker Paramount alleges insurance payout for the latest Tom Cruise installment does not cover losses.

item.title: Taste for takeaways outlasts Covid lockdowns
item.description: Britons are spending more on home delivered meals than before the pandemic struck.

item.title: YouTube signs Twitch video-game streamer Dr Lupo
item.description: Twitch says it wishes the American, 34, "nothing but the best in everything that comes next".

item.title: UK business confidence jumps to more than four-year high, survey finds
item.description: Lloyds survey finds North West England leads level of confidence despite caution over inflation.

item.title: Theranos scandal: Who is Elizabeth Holmes and why is she on trial?
item.description: The former boss of blood testing company Theranos is accused of fraud and could face years in jail.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Toyota restarts driverless vehicles after accident
item.description: A visually impaired athlete from Japan's judo team was hit by one of the e-Palette pods on Thursday.

item.title: Nike is giving its head office staff a week's break
item.description: The sports shoe giant is giving US head office staff this week off after a "traumatic" year.

item.title: Covid threatens Singapore's business hub crown
item.description: The South East Asian country faces opposing pressures over the large number of workers from overseas.

item.title: Japan's huge army of under-employed ex-housewives
item.description: Why women are still battling for better jobs in the world's third largest economy.

item.title: The pubs and restaurants counting on Christmas cheer
item.description: In a bid to rebound from Covid plans for this year's festive season are under way.

item.title: CEO Secrets: 'Tear up the business plan'
item.description: CEO Secrets: Brooklyn Brewery boss Eric Ottaway says - be ready to ditch your business plan.

item.title: Can the US crack down on fake vaccination cards?
item.description: As more people are asked to prove vaccination status, a black market in fake health cards has boomed.

item.title: How to keep your cool when the office heats up
item.description: Buildings that are too hot are bad for your health and productivity but simple measures can help.

item.title: Why phone scams are so difficult to tackle
item.description: Phone fraud, both via calls and text messages, has soared during the pandemic.
